day1.txt:
Day 1
Monday on Route (Today's Focus: Sales Center Start/End of Day Process)

message1.txt: Welcome! Your first step each day will be to initiate 'Start of Day' procedures in the HHC system. It is critical to ensure these activities are completed correctly as they will help ensure you stay organized throughout the entire day.

tasks.task1: Verify the sales date on the screen. Call support at 1-855-218-1613

message2.txt: Once you have received the daily Load Invoice, validate that you have received all product listed. Compare physical product to quantities listed on Load Invoice. Use the HHC to make any needed adjustments to your original Load Invoice. Mark any and all adjustments on the Load Invoice as well.

tasks.task1: Validate load invoice quantities compared to physical product

message3.txt: After making any needed adjustments to Load Invoice, finalize the Load Invoice in your HHC. Once Load Invoice is finalized you will need to print a Stop Distribution Report to aid in building your load by customer. Best practice is to track products by checking off products directly on your Stop Distribution Report.

tasks.task1: Sync printer

message1.txt: Using the Stop Distribution Report, stage and build out your product load by customer. Use a different set of trays and dollies for each customer, building each load by SKU. Once you have completed your load, a best practice is to 'tag' each stack with the name of the customer it is planned for. This will allow for you to keep customers organized together on your delivery vehicle.

tasks.task1: Stage trays and dollies by customer
tasks.task3: Build load and check off UPCs from stop distribution report
tasks.task4: Tag completed stacks with customer name and number

message2.txt: Once you have completed building your load, submit your updated Load Invoice to the Depot Coordinator for adjustments. In unmanned facilities you will need to follow the local process for making adjustments.

tasks.task1: Submit load invoice for credit

message1.txt: After building your load and making any needed adjustments to your Load Invoice you will need to load your delivery vehicle. Best practice is to load customers in reverse order, with your last customers being loaded first and your first customers being loaded last. Be sure to secure any and all loads before departing the Sales Center dock. Be sure to clean up your work area after building your load, placing all trays and dollies in the proper locations and removing any trash from your work area. Ensure you have your HHC and Printer, along with any needed POS materials and extra printer paper, before departing the Sales Center.

tasks.task1: Load stacks in reverse route order (last stops first / first stops last)
tasks.task2: Secure all dollies and boxed product
tasks.task3: Stack and return empty trays
tasks.task4: Grab all supplied (HHC, printer paper, POS materials) before departing
tasks.task5: Note the invoice on record is what is charged that day

message1.txt: Whew! That was a lot to take in this morning! For the rest of the day, observe your COACH as they operate their route. Feel free to ask questions as you go. Pay attention to how your COACH merchandises product on the shelves and displays.

tasks.task1: Operate the route as usual
tasks.task3: Explain date coding on bags and packages

message1.txt: Almost there! The last step in your day will be to initiate 'End of Day' procedures in the HHC. It is crucial these activities are completed correctly to ensure proper accounting of returns and any product remaining on the truck (truckstock). This is the final step in your daily product accountability process.

tasks.task1: Initiate end of day procedures
tasks.task3: Verify truck stock inventory

day1.final_message: Tomorrow will be a day with the OSL in classroom. Establish a start time and plan to meet them at the Sales Center.

day2.txt:
Day 2
Tuesday Classroom Day with OSL (Today's Focus: Fundamentals, Introductions to Systems)

message1.txt: Welcome back! Today you will spend the day with the Operational Sales Leader (OSL). You will get several pieces of valuable information and begin to familiarize yourself with several processes.

tasks.task1: Welcome the NEW IBP to the Sales Center

message2.txt: Knowing the BBU associates in the Sales Center will make you feel more comfortable and provide additional resources for assistance. The OSL will facilitate brief introductions of BBU associates in your Sales Center. While meeting these associates, you will tour the Sales Center to familiarize yourself. The OSL will also explain any important Safety and Operational protocols, including a recap of the load shipping process.

tasks.task1: Introduce NEW IBP to any BBU associates
tasks.task2: Tour Sales Center explaining Safety and Operational protocols

message1.txt: There are several important pieces of information you will need to be successful in the operation of your route. The OSL will provide those to you this morning.

tasks.task1: Give local contact numbers
tasks.task2: Give IBP branded shirts and ordering information
tasks.task3: Hand out samples of core products

message1.txt: Understanding the power of our Brands and proper Merchandising standards will aid in your success as a Business Owner. The OSL has several Brand Education and Merchandising videos for you to view.

tasks.task1: Show brand education videos

message1.txt: Understanding the Distribution Agreement is important. The OSL will review both the IBP and Bakery obligations under the Distribution Agreement with you.

tasks.task1: Review Article 4 & 6 (Sale of Product & Distributor Obligations)

message1.txt: You will need access to ION, BBU's proprietary ordering system. You will learn more about ION and how to place orders later in your Onboarding. For now, the OSL will need to request access to ION for you. This access will be effective once you take possession of the route after the Effective Date of Purchase.

tasks.task1: Request ION access for the NEW IBP

message1.txt: Understanding all the functions of the HHC will allow for easier use in route operations. The OSL will discuss the important functions of the HHC with you.

tasks.task1: Discuss SBT product life-cycle and how account for product

day2.final_message: Tomorrow will be a day with the MSL in classroom and market. Establish a start time and plan to meet them at the Sales Center.

day3.txt:
Day 3
Wednesday Market Day with MSL (Today's Focus: Market)

message1.txt: Understanding which products are most important to your business will aid in your success. The Market Sales Leader (MSL) will go through a business review of the accounts in the geography you are purchasing. This will include products that drive growth and freshness.

tasks.task1: Discuss business using Qlik (frontline Business Review)
tasks.task2: Identify core products and growth drivers
tasks.task3: Identify core products lagging in freshness

message1.txt: Knowing how to sell your products to store decision makers is important. Fact Based Selling will help gain secondary displays to support promotional events. The MSL will guide you through the Fact Based Selling process.

tasks.task1: Communicate benefits of fact based selling

message2.txt: You will regularly receive communication in regards to upcoming promotions with your customers via Promotional Calendars. Understanding how to access and read these calendars will aid in proper promotional planning and ordering.

tasks.task1: Show how to access and read promotional calendars
tasks.task2: Explain importance of promotional calendars when ordering

message1.txt: It is important to familiarize yourself with your accounts. Knowing where they are, what the layout of the store is, and where secondary displays are located will ease the transition into route ownership. The MSL will take you on a tour of your major accounts, allowing you to get a feel for them and meet store decision makers.

tasks.task1: Tour market including major accounts

day3.final_message: Tomorrow will be a day with your COACH. Establish a start time and plan to meet them at the Sales Center.
